quote: One must find the source within one's own Self, one must possess it. Everything else was seeking -- a detour, an error.
author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha

quote: Originality is the art of concealing your source.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources
author: C.E.M. Joad

quote: In quoting others, we cite ourselves.
author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

quote: The artist belongs to his work, not the work to the artist.
author: Novalis

quote: Therefore we will not listen to the source itself in order to learn what it is or what it means, but rather to the turns of speech, the allegories, figures, metaphors, as you will, into which the source has deviated, in order to lose it or rediscover it—which always amounts to the same.
author: Jacques Derrida

quote: An original artist is unable to copy. So he has only to copy in order to be original.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Ideas are the source of all things
author: Plato

quote: A scientist can pretend that his work isn't himself, it's merely the impersonal truth. An artist can't hide behind the truth. He can't hide anywhere.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Dispossessed

quote: There can be no forced inspiration.
author: Dejan Stojanovic

quote: Inspiration vs. Plagiarism [10w] Inspiration is improving on another's idea;plagiarism is copy/paste piracy.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Blame is the creed of the disempowered.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Of all lies, art is the least untrue.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quote: A critic should be taught to criticise a work of art without making any reference to the personality of the author.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Nothing of me is original. I am the combined effort of everyone I've ever known.
author: Chuck Palahniuk,  Invisible Monsters

quote: Every mind which has given itself to self-expression in art is aware of a directing agency outside its conscious control which it has agreed to label 'inspiration'.
author: Norman Lindsay

quote: An artist is not paid for his labor but for his vision.
author: James Whistler

quote: Even as a solid rock is unshaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: An original writer is not one who imitates nobody, but one whom nobody can imitate.
author: François-René de Chateaubriand,  The Genius of Christianity or the Spirit and Beauty of the Christian Religion

quote: No one is to blame because there is no one other than you. Nothing is to disrespect because there is nothing other than you.
author: Amit Ray

quote: Blaming is so much easier than taking responsibility, because if you take responsibility … then you might be to blame.
author: Jennifer O'Neill,  The Pursuit of Happiness: 21 Spiritual Rules to Sucess

quote: The writer, when he is also an artist, is someone who admits what others don't dare reveal.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: If your daily life seems poor, do not blame it; blame yourself, tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches; for to the creator there is no poverty and no poor indifferent place.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke,  Letters to a Young Poet

quote: ...Make God's Word your Sourcebook...
author: David Jeremiah,  Until Christ Returns: Living Faithfully Today While We Wait for Our Glorious Tomorrow

quote: To make a deliberate falsification for personal gain is the last, worst depth to which either scholar or artist can descend in work or life.(Letter to Muriel St. Clare Byrne, 8 September 1935)
author: Dorothy L. Sayers,  The Letters of Dorothy L. Sayers. Vol. 1, 1899-1936: The Making of a Detective Novelist

quote: You can't blame a writer for what the characters say.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Artists don't make objects. Artists make mythologies.
author: Anish Kapoor

quote: The plural of anecdote is not data.
author: Marc Bekoff

quote: Any authentic work of art must start an argument between the artist and his audience.
author: Rebecca West

quote: Acknowledgement is possession. When you acknowledge, think or have conviction in something, it actually will come true.
author: Stephen Richards,  Boost Your Self Esteem

quote: Foreknowledge cannot be gotten from ghosts and spirits, cannot be had by analogy, cannot be found out by calculation. It must be obtained from people, people who know the conditions of the enemy.
author: Sun Tzu,  The Art of War

quote: There is no God, Nature sufficeth unto herself; in no wise hath she need of an author.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: I criticize by creation, not by finding fault.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The Creator has – I say it in all reverence - drawn a myriad red herrings across the track, but the true scientist refuses to be baffled by superficial appearances in detecting the secrets of Nature. The vulgar herd catches at the gross apparent fact, but the man of insight knows what lies on the surfaces does lie.
author: Israel Zangwill,  The Big Bow Mystery

quote: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
author: Emile Zola

quote: Most people believe the mind to be a mirror, more or less accurately reflecting the world outside them, not realizing on the contrary that the mind is itself the principal element of creation.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: To recognize untruth as a condition of life--that certainly means resisting accustomed value feelings in a dangerous way; and a philosophy that risks this would by that token alone place itself beyond good and evil.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Beyond Good and Evil

quote: I mean that we here are on the wrong side of the tapestry,' answered Father Brown. 'The things that happen here do not seem to mean anything; they mean something somewhere else. Somewhere else retribution will come on the real offender. Here it often seems to fall on the wrong person.
author: G.K. Chesterton,  The Innocence of Father Brown

quote: I would rather be attacked than unnoticed. For the worst thing you can do to an author is to be silent as to his works.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The artist's job is not to succumb to despair but to find an antidote for the emptiness of existence.
author: Woody Allen

quote: The argument goes something like this: "I refuse to prove that I exist,"says God, "for proof denies faith, and without faith I am nothing.
author: Douglas Adams,  The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: There are no facts, only interpretations.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Mirrors are perpetually deceitful. They lie and steal your true self. They reveal only what your mind believes it sees
author: Dee Remy,  There Once Was A Boy

quote: Even a true artist does not always produce art.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: Nothing is art if it does not come from nature.
author: Antoni Gaudi

quote: Thought is the original source of all wealth, all success, all material gain, all great discoveries and inventions, and of all achievement.
author: Claude M. Bristol

quote: If all men are made in God's reflection, then why do some people continue to acknowledge only what is in their part of the mirror? If every man was created equal and in the image of God, then how can any man claim that one race is better than another?
author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: The fossil record implies trial and error, the inability to anticipate the future, features inconsistent with a Great Designer (though not a Designer of a more remote and indirect temperament.)
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos
